text: John Chatham (16 October 1866 - 28 February 1925) was an Australian politician. He was born in Napoleons to farmer James Chatham and Margaret Hanlon. He worked in various sawmills and as a contractor before buying land at Rokewood Junction and becoming a leading wheat farmer. On 25 August 1897 he married Ellen McGrath, with whom he had four children. He was elected to the Victorian Legislative Assembly at a by-election in 1913, representing Grenville as a member of the Labor Party. He was expelled for supporting conscription in the 1916 Labor split, and did not run for re-election in 1917. Chatham died in 1925 in Ballarat. ==References== Category:1866 births Category:1925 deaths Category:Australian Labor Party members of the Parliament of Victoria Category:Nationalist Party of Australia members of the Parliament of Victoria Category:Members of the Victorian Legislative Assembly
title: John Chatham (Australian politician)
